content.description: Stand start on left side of the large crack that traverses up and right. Follow crack.
content.location: On the Matter of Time boulder. Located to the right of Matter of Time and the left of Dat Crack. On the side facing the trail.

content.description: Start on the bulge to the right of Easy Money. You will find good jugs on either side of the bulge and low feet. Move up using jugs on the top edge of the bulge. Pull over and walk it up to the top.
content.location: Directly to the right of Easy Money, you will see a large bulge in the rock sticking out about 4 feet off the ground. Start with feet under the bulge and hand on either side.

content.description: It's named after the boulder it's on (Money Ball Boulder), and it's the best line. Start low on the small overhanging section that is to the left of the money symbol spray-painted on the front of the boulder. Use small feet on the right edge of the overhang and start compressed as low as possible. Move up to a side pull crimp, throw a heal hook and grab the rounded top of the overhang. Finish straight up, using rounded jugs.
content.protection: One pad is more than enough.
content.location: Located on the Money Ball Boulder, which is the first boulder you will see from the trail if you are coming from the parking area. The boulder has big discs on the front and a faint money symbol ($) spray-painted on it. Walk to the left around the boulder and you will see a small overhanging section. That's where you will find the Money Ball problem.

content.description: Start on an obvious edge to the right of the chalked overhang. Push off chossy feet to a hollow flake and top out up and out left. BEWARE** Flake is hollow and could break, CLIMB AT YOUR OWN RISK.
content.location: The Matter of Time boulder is to the right of Money Ball boulder and behind the Whale boulder which is right on the trail. You will see the overhang jutting out towards the trail.

content.description: Start on low edges about 4 feet off the ground. Climb up small edges to large lip and top out straight up.
content.location: Located on the backside of Money Ball boulder, just to the left of Money Ball problem.

content.description: Climb the chimney on the backside of Money Ball boulder. It's a perfect width for putting your back on one side and your feet on the other.
content.location: On the backside of Money Ball boulder, there is a big split in the rock that creates a chimney. Step into the split and climb up however you want.

content.description: This problem is on the front face of the Money Ball boulder, just to the right of the money symbol ($) for which the boulder gets its name. It's a very nice V0 slab with obvious sloppy handholds and pretty good feet. A great confidence builder for beginners going outside for the first time.
content.location: The Money Ball boulder is the first boulder you see from the trail if you are coming from the parking lot. This boulder is located in the Rocky Glen Pond area.

content.description: Climb the large vertical crack straight up, using good feet and horizontal cracks for extra hands along the way. Fun warm-up climb. Also, a great climb for beginners going outside for the first time.
content.location: On the backside of the boulder with the Matter of Time overhang on the front. You can see it easily from the trail if you walk past the boulders. The crack is on the side facing the pond.

content.description: Sit start low on prow using very low foot hold, just off the ground. Pop a heel and peel either right or left to top out.
content.location: Located on the Beached Whale boulder, which is right along the Rocky Glen trail. The boulder is actually touching the trail. This problem is located on the small prow at the left end of the boulder.

content.description: Start on the obvious edge on the arete to the right of Dat Crack. Climb straight up slabby face. Start hand is breaking, so be careful. Feet Only version is V2! Good warm up climb for beginners.
content.protection: 1-2 pads. There are a few rocks at the bottom.
content.location: On the back side of Matter of Time boulder. Climb faces the pond. To the right of Dat Crack.

content.description: This area is a 10-minute hike in from the Blue Mountain Summit Trial Head. Boulders are sitting to the left of the trail, just after the trail reaches the pond. This area has 3 main boulders that all have multiple climbs on them, making this a nice area to warm up.
